# setTextColor(_:)

**Instance Method**

Sets the color to apply to plain text strings.

## Declaration

```swift
func setTextColor(_ color: UIColor?)
```

## Parameters

- **color**: The custom color to be applied to the labelâ€™s text. Specifying `nil` removes the custom color and returns the text to the color specified in the storyboard file. The default label color is white.

## Discussion

The value set by this method represents the default color applied to text. This color is used unless you explicitly override it in an attributed string using the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/UIKit/NSForegroundColorAttributeName] attribute.

## Setting the Label Text

- **setText(_:)**: Sets the label text to the specified string.
- **setAttributedText(_:)**: Sets the label text to the specified attributed string.
